content: p l y m o u t h y a r n® b221 free pattern with our compliments find inspiration www plymouthyarn com sonnet butterfly stitch cowl approximate finished measurements 9 width x 34 circumference after blocking materials sonnet 1 100g skein shown in color 84 copper gauge 21 sts = 4 in butterfly stitch us size 5 3 75mm knitting needle after blocking needles/notions us size 4 3 5mm and 5 3 75mm 24 circular needle 1 stitch marker work either the charted or written instructions for the butterfly stitch if you are working from the chart work all rnds from right to left butterfly stitch multiple of 12 sts rnds 1 3 5 7 9 *sl 5 sts wyif k5 repeat from * around rnds 2 4 6 8 k around round 10 *k2 insert the left hand needle through the 5 loose strands and up onto the needle knit these 5 sts together with the next stitch on the needle k7 repeat from * around rnds 11 13 15 17 19 *k5 sl 5 sts wyif repeat from * around rnds 12 14 16 18 k around round 20 *k7 insert the left hand needle through the 5 loose strands and up onto the needle knit these 5 sts together with the next stitch on the needle k2 repeat from * around repeat these 20 rnds for pattern st begin with smaller circular needle long-tail co 180 sts join in the round being careful not to twist sts pm to mark beg of round eyelet edge round 1 k around round 2 p around rnds 3 and 4 same as round 1 and 2 abbrevations beg= beginning bobble= bind off co= cast on cont= continue k = knit k2tog= knit two stitches together mm= millimeter pm= place marker p = purl repeat= repeat sl = slip st s = stitch es st st = stockinette st decrease = together round- round wyif= with yarn in front yo= yarn over p l y m o u t h y a r n® b221 free pattern with our compliments find inspiration www plymouthyarn com round 5 *yo k2tog repeat from * around round 6 p around rnds 7 and 8 same as round 1 and 2 round 9 k around body switch to larger circular needle work rnds 1-20 of butterfly stitch four times 80 rnds total work in butterfly stitch eyelet edge switch to smaller circular needle round 1 k around round 2 p around rnds 3 and 4 same as round 1 and 2 round 5 *yo k2tog repeat from * around round 6 p around rnds 7 and 8 same as round 1 and 2 bobble all sts in k on next round using your favorite stretchy bobble method finishing - block to measurements gently steaming the butterfly stitch section to relax the stitches weave in all ends ©2025 plymouth yarn company 080625jbt abbrevations beg= beginning bobble= bind off co= cast on cont= continue k =
